column4: can anyone tell me how to stop grub from loading when I turn on the computer?
you mean so it hides the menu?
cause if GRUB doesn't load, then Linux won't load, and Ubuntu won't load.
I understand, I don'tw ant ubuntu to load
so you mean you want to completely remove Ubuntu?
or just default to something else?
default to something else would be preferable
I need to test something, but grub is getting in the way
I need to run this recovery partition but when I try to , grub menu loads up and the recovery process stops
the recovery parition is to recover a windows partition
ok. GRUB is installed in the MBR of your hard drive, outside of any partitions. You may be able to add the recovery partition as a Windows system to GRUB.
oh okay, how would I do that if you don't mind ? thanks
if you already have Windows installed and set up in GRUB you should be able to copy the Windows option that already exists and modify it for your recovery partition.
okay I will try that, thank you
